Pinjol Abal-abal Merajalela, Servernya dari Mana?
01 Nov 2019, 04:36 by Sylke Febrina Laucereno


Foto: Pinjam Online (Tim Infografis: Andhika Akbarayansyah)

Jakarta - Financial technology (fintech) pinjaman online ilegal saat ini masih marak di Indonesia. Layanan tersebut sangat meresahkan karena memberlakukan bunga yang besar hingga ancaman saat penagihan. Dari mana saja fintech-fintech tersebut berasal?Ketua Satgas Waspada Investasi Tongam L Tobing menjelaskan dari hasil temuan aplikasi fintech lending yang diblokir memang ada server yang berasal dari luar negeri. Misalnya dari Amerika Serikat (AS) 15%, Singapura 8%, China 6%, Malaysia 2%, Hong Kong 1%, Rusia 1% dan lain-lain 3%. "Memang ada fintech pinjaman online ilegal ini dari berbagai negara," kata Tongam di The Gade Coffe & Gold, Kementerian BUMN, Jumat (1/11/2019).Tongam mengungkapkan saat ini pemblokiran dilakukan dengan sinergi antar lembaga terkait. Seperti Kementerian Kominfo, Otoritas Jasa Keuangan (OJK), satgas waspada investasi sampai Google. Dia menceritakan, beberapa bulan lalu ada fintech ilegal asal Korea Selatan yang diblokir oleh Satgas. Kemudian perwakilan kedutaan besar Korea Selatan yang datang ke satgas dan meminta maaf. "Pernah ada perwakilan kedubes Korea Selatan datang minta maaf, karena ada server di sana yang terindikasi fintech ilegal. Dia langsung mencari di sana dan diblokir, karena dia tidak ingin tercemar. Karena itu dia mengajak kerja sama untuk pemblokiran secara cepat jika ada yang berasal dari Korea Selatan," imbuh dia.Dari data Satgas, hingga 31 Oktober 2019, ditemukan 297 entitas fintech ilegal yang sudah diblokir. Saat ini jumlah perusahaan fintech lending yang terdaftar dan berizin di OJK hingga September mencapai 127 perusahaan.Berdasarkan data OJK, penyaluran pinjaman P2P lending per 31 Agustus 2019 mencapai Rp 54,7 triliun dengan jumlah peminjam 530.385 peminjam di mana 207.507 merupakan entitas serta untuk jumlah pemberi pinjaman 12,8 juta di mana 4,4 juta merupakan entitas.Simak Video "Telat Bayar Utang Fintech, Wanita di Solo Diteror"[Gambas:Video 20detik](kil/ang)

Pinjol is completely rampant, where is the server from?
Nov 01 2019, 04:36 by Sylke Febrina Laucereno


Photo: Online Loan (Infographic Team: Andhika Akbarayansyah)

Jakarta - Financial technology (fintech) illegal online loans is still rife in Indonesia. The service is very unsettling because it imposes a large interest to the threat when billing. Where did the finteches come from? The Head of the Alert Investments Task Force Tongam L Tobing explained that from the findings of the blocked fintech lending application, there were indeed servers from overseas. For example from the United States (US) 15%, Singapore 8%, China 6%, Malaysia 2%, Hong Kong 1%, Russia 1% and others 3%. "There is indeed an illegal online loan fintech from various countries," said Tongam at The Gade Coffe & Gold, Ministry of SOEs, Friday (11/01/2019). Tongam revealed that the blocking was currently carried out with synergy between related institutions. Like the Ministry of Communication and Information, the Financial Services Authority (OJK), the investment alert task force to Google. He told, a few months ago there was illegal fintech from South Korea that was blocked by the Task Force. Then representatives of the South Korean embassy came to the task force and apologized. "Once a representative of the South Korean embassy came to apologize, because there was a server there that indicated illegal fintech. He immediately searched there and was blocked, because he did not want to be polluted. Therefore he invited cooperation to block it quickly if there was something from South Korea, "he added. From the Task Force's data, as of October 31, 2019, 297 illegal fintech entities were found that had been blocked.
